thread.title: Devils, Tigers will battle for title
thread.title_full: Devils, Tigers will battle for title

title: Devils, Tigers will battle for title
text:
Devils, Tigers will battle for title Josh Chapin , jchapin@richmond.gannett.com 12:03 a.m. EDT October 2, 2015 Richmond's Logan Mayer returns the ball during the tennis sectional Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015 at Richmond. (Photo: Palladium-Item Joshua Smith) 6 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Richmond is one win away from a repeat. 
Hagerstown is the last team standing between the Red Devils and a 30th overall sectional title in boys tennis. Both teams won by twin scores of 4-1 during a wind-swept Thursday on the Tiernan Center courts, setting up Friday's 4:30 p.m. final. 
"We battled today," said Richmond's Logan Mayer, who won in three sets at No. 2 singles for the defending sectional champion. "I'm just really glad that we're back in the sectional championship." 
Richmond halted Centerville, while Hagerstown knocked off Northeastern. 
The Tigers aim for their first sectional title since 2009, the second of back-to-back championships for the program. 
Hagerstown has built momentum under first-year coach Courtney Ecker. The Tigers are now 16-2, and earlier this week won the Tri-Eastern Conference Tournament to force a tie for the overall title with Centerville. Ben Tinkle, Isaiah Neal and Nick Arnold swept singles play for Hagerstown on Thursday, with Jordan Auker and Trey Kelley winning at No. 1 doubles to make the 4-1 final. 
"I'm really proud of them. They're doing a nice job," Ecker said. 
"Northeastern has improved so much from the beginning of the season until now. The fact that we can beat them 4-1 tonight is great for my guys because they are a good team top to bottom." 
Northeastern's Ryan Wogoman and Michael McDaniel won at No. 2 doubles. 
Brothers Eric Hollingsworth (No. 1 singles) and Ryan Hollingsworth (No. 3) gave Richmond an early 2-0 advantage in its semifinal vs. Centerville. 
Two of the remaining flights went three sets, but Mayer clinched the victory for the Red Devils by outlasting Nolan Witte 6-3, 3-6, 6-3. 
It was a reversal of the outcome of last week's meeting between the two in Centerville, when Witte edged Mayer in three sets. 
"Witte is a really good player. He just gets everything back," Mayer said. "I felt like I played my best tennis today. It was just good to get the win." 
Centerville's Nathan Cheek and Josh Duke won at No. 2 doubles, while the Bulldogs and Red Devils battled under the lights in the day's longest match. Richmond's Jacob Weiss and Ross Doughty persevered, winning 6-4, 6-7 (9-11), 6-1 at No. 1 doubles. 
"I knew this was going to be a tough match. They're a good team," RHS coach Randy Hollingsworth said of the Bulldogs. "We had some chances to put it away sooner than we did, but we'll take it. It's a win. 
"I'm really proud of the way he (Mayer) played. He lost a couple of tough matches a week or so ago, and he hung tough. I'm really proud of the way he played tonight." 
Richmond is now 18-2 overall. Richmond and Hagerstown met in August in an early season match, with the Red Devils prevailing 5-0. 
Playing consistent will be key for RHS. 
"We haven't had any lulls really in our play, and as long as we play like we have been I think we'll be fine," Randy Hollingsworth said. 
"They (the Tigers) are playing well. They've got some momentum and we've got to come to play." 
Ecker praised the Tigers' play across the board. 
"My doubles teams are playing as a doubles team, and my singles guys have done a really nice job hanging in there," she said. "No matter if they're down or they're up, they're pulling through for me. They're doing a nice job. 
"Mentally, we have to stay tough. That's pretty much my main focus tomorrow." 
Josh Chapin: (765) 973-4463 jchapin@pal-item.com or twitter.com/JoshChapinPI 
TIGERS 4, KNIGHTS 1 
SINGLES — Tinkle (H) def. Kenworthy 6-0, 6-3; No. 2 - Neal (H) def. Stiner 6-2, 6-4; No. 3 - Arnold (H) def. Clay 6-4, 2-6, 6-3. 
DOUBLES — No. 1 - Auker and Kelley (H) def. Vick and Reynolds 7-6, (7-3), 6-2; No. 2 - Wogoman and McDaniel (NE) def. Hoover and Neal 6-3, 6-3. 
RED DEVILS 4, BULLDOGS 1 
SINGLES — No. 1 - E.Hollingsworth (RHS) def. Lair 6-0, 6-0; No. 2 - Mayer (RHS) def. Witte 6-3, 3-6, 6-3; No. 3 - R.Hollingsworth (RHS) def. Benedict 6-2, 6-1. 
DOUBLES — No. 1 - Weiss and Doughty (RHS) def. North and Shook 6-4, 6-7 (9-11), 6-1; No. 2 - Cheek and Duke (CEN) def. Jones and Gibbel 6-4, 6-2. 6 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://pinews.co/1FJPoh1 TOP VIDEOS
